alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 1:21PM PST until March 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, includes Macdoel, Dorris, and portions of Highways 97 and 139. For the Winter Weather Advisory, all other areas including Tulelake and Newell. * WHEN...From 10 AM Thursday to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
